Talk_3011:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>Just tell me you'll invite me to the very
first harvest!<sp:0:4:0>It'll take a bit before they're ready to
pick, but I'm already gettin' excited!
Talk_3012:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>Good. We have a nice little garden going
here. It'd be a shame to pull it up.<sp:0:4:0>I'll keep tending it, as you do.
Talk_3013:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>If you say so. We had a nice little garden
going here, but I don't mind pulling it up
if that's what you want.
Talk_3014:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>The only reason I'm able to work the
fields again is 'cause Princess Zelda
built us that school.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0c01><sp:0:2:2:5000>Hope they find out what happened to the
princess soon...<sp:0:4:0><sp:0:2:2:6400><sp:3:0:2:0701>Ah, sorry. Did you need something
from me?<sp:0:2:2:5000><sp:0:2:2:6400>
Talk_4000:
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:Happy_01>Thanks for bein' so patient! Whaddaya
think? They're tasty-lookin', aren't they?<sp:0:4:0>I was happy to tend 'em for you,
Professor Link.<sp:0:4:0>It's all the same to me what you do with
the produce we grow here. And if you
wanna grow somethin' else, let me know.
Talk_3016:
<sp:3:0:2:0701>But they're still freshly planted, so it'll be
<clr:0000>quite a while<clr:ffff> before they're ready to
harvest. <sp:5:0:0>These things take time, y'know.<sp:0:4:0>Try to be patient, OK?
Talk_1000:
<sp:3:0:2:0701>Oh, I know you. You're Professor Link,
right? I heard all about that from Symin.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:TalkPositive_00>My name is Uma. I look after the Hateno
school garden.<sp:0:4:0>You came right when I was finishing up
the prep work for this here plot.<sp:0:4:0>Symin said we should ask you what to
plant in it. You know, to celebrate you
becomin' a teacher and all.
Talk_3017:
<sp:3:0:2:0701>They've still got <clr:0000>a ways to go<clr:ffff> before
they're ready to be harvested.<sp:0:4:0>'Fraid you'll have to wait a while longer.
Talk_4003:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00>What're you up to there, Professor Link?!<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0701>We grew that crop the natural way, so I'll
thank you to harvest it the natural way
as well!
Talk_1001:
<sp:3:0:2:0701>Well, well. I wondered when you'd be by.<sp:0:4:0>Symin said we should ask you what to
plant in this here plot. You know, as
thanks for helpin' out with the school.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0100>You showed up just when I was finishing
the prep work for it.
Talk_3018:
<sp:3:0:2:0100>I expect <clr:0000>it won't be too much longer<clr:ffff>
before they're ready for the harvest.<sp:0:4:0>Try and hold out! It'll be worth the wait.
Talk_3019:
<sp:3:0:2:0801>They should be ready for the harvest
<clr:0000>anytime now<clr:ffff>. You won't have long to wait.
Talk_3020:
<sp:3:0:2:0701>There are no shortcuts when it comes to
raising vegetables.<sp:0:4:0>They won't grow if you while away the
hours at an inn or bonfire, so mind how
you pass the time.<sp:0:4:0>And of course, if you want to grow
something else here, you can always ask.
Talk_4007: <sp:3:0:2:0b00><snd:SurpriseL_01>I gotta put this fire out, quick!
Talk_1005:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>I could grow pumpkins, carrots, tomatoes,
wildberries, wheat, rice, or melons.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0701>If you bring me one of those, I'll extract
the seeds and plant 'em for you.
Talk_4008:
<sp:3:0:2:0a00><snd:Sad_01>*sigh* All my love and care almost came
to nothin'.<sp:0:4:0>I'm raisin' these out of the goodness of
my heart. Please treat 'em nice.
Talk_1006:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>I s'pose it's raining, but what's that to
a gardener? Let's talk about what you'd
like to grow.
Talk_4009:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>Come to help me water the plants,
Professor Link?
Talk_1007:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>Well, now. Let's get down to it. What
would you like to grow?
Talk_4010:
<sp:3:0:2:0801>That's sweet of you. I bet the crops are
glad to have a drink.
Talk_4011:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Thing is, it's raining right now, so I'm not
sure the veggies need any more water.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0800>Come back with that thing sometime the
sun's out. I bet they'll be thirstier then.
Near_2001: A little water for the plants.
Talk_3000: <sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Greeting_00>Hello there, and good morning to you!
Talk_2000:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Didja figure out what you want to grow?<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0501>I can do pumpkins, carrots, radishes,
tomatoes, wildberries, or hydromelons.<sp:5:0:0>
Wheat and rice too. Can't forget those.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0701>Which of those sounds good to you?
Talk_3003:
<sp:3:0:2:0701>I retired quite a while ago, but I was a
farmer for many years.<sp:0:4:0>Workin' the soil calms me down, even at
this age.<sp:0:4:0>Didja come to see the garden too?
Talk_3005:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>I can't return anything I've already
planted. You still wanna go ahead?
Talk_2004: <sp:3:0:2:0100>It's fine, it's fine. No hurries, no worries.
Talk_2005:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>Certainly! I'll take that from you and be
pleased to do it.<sp:0:4:0>Can't return anything once you hand it
over, mind, but if you feel like plantin'
something else, come see me.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0800>Oh, and I hope you'll let me know about
your first harvest so I can be there to see!<sp:0:4:0>I'm already hankerin' to see how the
crops turn out.<sp:0:4:0>But you have to know, the important part
of growing good crops is to take your
time raising them.<sp:0:4:0>You can't expect them to thrive while you
kill time at an inn or bonfire. That ain't
how things are done. The veggies know.<sp:0:4:0>So it'll take a bit before they're ready to
harvest, but I'm already gettin' excited!
Talk_2006:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>I could grow pumpkins, carrots, tomatoes,
wildberries, wheat, rice, or hydromelons.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0701>But if you don't have one of those, I can't
extract the seeds. Bring me one, and we
can get this plot started.
Talk_2007:
<sp:3:0:2:0400>Uh-oh. Looks like you don't have anything
good for planting.
Talk_2008:
<sp:3:0:2:0701>Before you decide, I should admit one
thing. <sp:5:0:0>I have more experience with some
crops than others.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0c00>I don't know too much yet about raising
endura carrots and hearty radishes.<sp:0:4:0>You'll have to forgive me if the yield on
those ends up a little lower than the rest.
Talk_3010: <sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Greeting_00>Hello there, and good evening to you!
